article.headline: Spanish court rules against Madridâs new COVID-19 restrictions
article.body: A health-care worker uses a spot infrared thermometer to measure the body temperature of a man before he has a rapid COVID-19 disease antigen test on September 29, 2020 in Madrid, Spain. Pablo Blazquez Dominguez/Getty Images Madridâs High Court ruled on Thursday that it wouldnât approve recent COVID-19 restrictions imposed on the region by the central government. The regional government has objected to the new rules, which include limits on capacity for businesses and limits on travel, without good reason, for individuals in affected regions such as Madrid. They were put in place as of Friday for any region that met criteria, such as Madrid, where cases have been soaring. The local government has appealed the restrictions and argued they will damage the economy further. According to El PaÃ­s, the high court must now rule on whether to suspend the Madrid restrictions, while considering the local governmentâs appeal against the measures.
